A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: The more I read the fans reactions\, the more I worry these fans don’t “get” this new trilogy. It’s about passing the torch. It’s about saying goodbye to the past while welcoming a new group heroes. It’s about breaking the mold. Episode VII was a pretty shameless remake of episode IV. That’s fine. But had this been a remake of “Empire” as it very well could have been (and even felt that way in the beginning) do you think the “fans” would have been happier? Since when does “fandom” mean you get to call the shots? Being a fan means you have love and respect for a property/character/franchise/creator\, perceived flaws and all. Even if events don’t pan out like you’d imagined. It’s about having faith and trust in the storytellers. Rian Johnson did an incredible job and took a ton of risks to make a main saga entry unlike any we’ve ever seen before. In the most interesting and positive way. It’s fine not to like it if you had problems with it. But to jump ship and trash it like this shows ignorance and arrogance. This a risky movie that expands the mythology in unexpected ways. If you think you can do better\, get a job at Disney. Otherwise\, I hope time will convince these sad “fans” this is\, in fact\, a strong entry.
